35/* buffer var allocations */
36#define arabic_shaping_action() ot_shaper_var_u8_auxiliary() /* arabic shaping action */
37
38#define HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_ARABIC_HAS_STCH HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_SHAPER0
39
40/* See:
41 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/commit/6e6f82b6f3dde0fc6c3c7d991d9ec6cfff57823d#commitcomment-14248516 */
42#define HB_ARABIC_GENERAL_CATEGORY_IS_WORD(gen_cat) \
43 (FLAG_UNSAFE (gen_cat) & \
44 (FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_UNASSIGNED) | \
45 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_PRIVATE_USE) | \
46 /*FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_LOWERCASE_LETTER) |*/ \
47 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_MODIFIER_LETTER) | \
48 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_OTHER_LETTER) | \
49 /*FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_TITLECASE_LETTER) |*/ \
50 /*FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_UPPERCASE_LETTER) |*/ \
51 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_SPACING_MARK) | \
52 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_ENCLOSING_MARK) | \
53 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_NON_SPACING_MARK) | \
54 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_DECIMAL_NUMBER) | \
55 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_LETTER_NUMBER) | \
56 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_OTHER_NUMBER) | \
57 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_CURRENCY_SYMBOL) | \
58 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_MODIFIER_SYMBOL) | \
59 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_MATH_SYMBOL) | \
60 FLAG (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_OTHER_SYMBOL)))
61
62
63/*
64 * Joining types:
65 */
66
67/*
68 * Bits used in the joining tables
69 */
70enum hb_arabic_joining_type_t {
71 JOINING_TYPE_U = 0,
72 JOINING_TYPE_L = 1,
73 JOINING_TYPE_R = 2,
74 JOINING_TYPE_D = 3,
75 JOINING_TYPE_C = JOINING_TYPE_D,
76 JOINING_GROUP_ALAPH = 4,
77 JOINING_GROUP_DALATH_RISH = 5,
78 NUM_STATE_MACHINE_COLS = 6,
79
80 JOINING_TYPE_T = 7,
81 JOINING_TYPE_X = 8 /* means: use general-category to choose between U or T. */
82};
83
84#include "hb-ot-shaper-arabic-table.hh"
85
86static unsigned int get_joining_type (hb_codepoint_t u, hb_unicode_general_category_t gen_cat)
87{
88 unsigned int j_type = joining_type(u);
89 if (likely (j_type != JOINING_TYPE_X))
90 return j_type;
91
92 return (FLAG_UNSAFE(gen_cat) &
93 (FLAG(HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_NON_SPACING_MARK) |
94 FLAG(HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_ENCLOSING_MARK) |
95 FLAG(HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_FORMAT))
96 ) ? JOINING_TYPE_T : JOINING_TYPE_U;
97}
98
99#define FEATURE_IS_SYRIAC(tag) hb_in_range<unsigned char> ((unsigned char) (tag), '2', '3')
100
101static const hb_tag_t arabic_features[] =
102{
103 HB_TAG('i','s','o','l'),
104 HB_TAG('f','i','n','a'),
105 HB_TAG('f','i','n','2'),
106 HB_TAG('f','i','n','3'),
107 HB_TAG('m','e','d','i'),
108 HB_TAG('m','e','d','2'),
109 HB_TAG('i','n','i','t'),
110 HB_TAG_NONE
111};
112
113
114/* Same order as the feature array */
115enum arabic_action_t {
116 ISOL,
117 FINA,
118 FIN2,
119 FIN3,
120 MEDI,
121 MED2,
122 INIT,
123
124 NONE,
125
126 ARABIC_NUM_FEATURES = NONE,
127
128 /* We abuse the same byte for other things... */
129 STCH_FIXED,
130 STCH_REPEATING,
131};
132
133static const struct arabic_state_table_entry {
134 uint8_t prev_action;
135 uint8_t curr_action;
136 uint16_t next_state;
137} arabic_state_table[][NUM_STATE_MACHINE_COLS] =
138{
139 /* jt_U, jt_L, jt_R, jt_D, jg_ALAPH, jg_DALATH_RISH */
140
141 /* State 0: prev was U, not willing to join. */
142 { {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: NONE,.next_state: 0}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 1}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 1}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 6}, },
143
144 /* State 1: prev was R or ISOL/ALAPH, not willing to join. */
145 { {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: NONE,.next_state: 0}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 1}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: FIN2,.next_state: 5}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 6}, },
146
147 /* State 2: prev was D/L in ISOL form, willing to join. */
148 { {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: NONE,.next_state: 0}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: INIT,.curr_action: FINA,.next_state: 1}, {.prev_action: INIT,.curr_action: FINA,.next_state: 3}, {.prev_action: INIT,.curr_action: FINA,.next_state: 4}, {.prev_action: INIT,.curr_action: FINA,.next_state: 6}, },
149
150 /* State 3: prev was D in FINA form, willing to join. */
151 { {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: NONE,.next_state: 0}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: MEDI,.curr_action: FINA,.next_state: 1}, {.prev_action: MEDI,.curr_action: FINA,.next_state: 3}, {.prev_action: MEDI,.curr_action: FINA,.next_state: 4}, {.prev_action: MEDI,.curr_action: FINA,.next_state: 6}, },
152
153 /* State 4: prev was FINA ALAPH, not willing to join. */
154 { {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: NONE,.next_state: 0}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: MED2,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 1}, {.prev_action: MED2,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: MED2,.curr_action: FIN2,.next_state: 5}, {.prev_action: MED2,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 6}, },
155
156 /* State 5: prev was FIN2/FIN3 ALAPH, not willing to join. */
157 { {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: NONE,.next_state: 0}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: ISOL,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 1}, {.prev_action: ISOL,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: ISOL,.curr_action: FIN2,.next_state: 5}, {.prev_action: ISOL,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 6}, },
158
159 /* State 6: prev was DALATH/RISH, not willing to join. */
160 { {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: NONE,.next_state: 0}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 1}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 2}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: FIN3,.next_state: 5}, {.prev_action: NONE,.curr_action: ISOL,.next_state: 6}, }
161};
162

164static bool
165arabic_fallback_shape (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan,
166 hb_font_t *font,
167 hb_buffer_t *buffer);
168
169static bool
170record_stch (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan,
171 hb_font_t *font,
172 hb_buffer_t *buffer);
173
174static bool
175deallocate_buffer_var (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan,
176 hb_font_t *font,
177 hb_buffer_t *buffer)
178{
179 HB_BUFFER_DEALLOCATE_VAR (buffer, arabic_shaping_action);
180 return false;
181}
182
183static void
184collect_features_arabic (hb_ot_shape_planner_t *plan)
185{
186 hb_ot_map_builder_t *map = &plan->map;
187
188 /* We apply features according to the Arabic spec, with pauses
189 * in between most.
190 *
191 * The pause between init/medi/... and rlig is required. See eg:
192 * https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=644184
193 *
194 * The pauses between init/medi/... themselves are not necessarily
195 * needed as only one of those features is applied to any character.
196 * The only difference it makes is when fonts have contextual
197 * substitutions. We now follow the order of the spec, which makes
198 * for better experience if that's what Uniscribe is doing.
199 *
200 * At least for Arabic, looks like Uniscribe has a pause between
201 * rlig and calt. Otherwise the IranNastaliq's ALLAH ligature won't
202 * work. However, testing shows that rlig and calt are applied
203 * together for Mongolian in Uniscribe. As such, we only add a
204 * pause for Arabic, not other scripts.
205 */
206
207
208 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG('s','t','c','h'));
209 map->add_gsub_pause (pause_func: record_stch);
210
211 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG('c','c','m','p'), flags: F_MANUAL_ZWJ);
212 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG('l','o','c','l'), flags: F_MANUAL_ZWJ);
213
214 map->add_gsub_pause (pause_func: nullptr);
215
216 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < ARABIC_NUM_FEATURES; i++)
217 {
218 bool has_fallback = plan->props.script == HB_SCRIPT_ARABIC && !FEATURE_IS_SYRIAC (arabic_features[i]);
219 map->add_feature (tag: arabic_features[i], flags: F_MANUAL_ZWJ | (has_fallback ? F_HAS_FALLBACK : F_NONE));
220 map->add_gsub_pause (pause_func: nullptr);
221 }
222 map->add_gsub_pause (pause_func: deallocate_buffer_var);
223
224 /* Normally, Unicode says a ZWNJ means "don't ligate". In Arabic script
225 * however, it says a ZWJ should also mean "don't ligate". So we run
226 * the main ligating features as MANUAL_ZWJ. */
227
228 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG('r','l','i','g'), flags: F_MANUAL_ZWJ | F_HAS_FALLBACK);
229
230 if (plan->props.script == HB_SCRIPT_ARABIC)
231 map->add_gsub_pause (pause_func: arabic_fallback_shape);
232
233 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG('c','a','l','t'), flags: F_MANUAL_ZWJ);
234 /* https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/1573 */
235 if (!map->has_feature (HB_TAG('r','c','l','t')))
236 {
237 map->add_gsub_pause (pause_func: nullptr);
238 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG('r','c','l','t'), flags: F_MANUAL_ZWJ);
239 }
240
241 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG('l','i','g','a'), flags: F_MANUAL_ZWJ);
242 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG('c','l','i','g'), flags: F_MANUAL_ZWJ);
243
244 /* The spec includes 'cswh'. Earlier versions of Windows
245 * used to enable this by default, but testing suggests
246 * that Windows 8 and later do not enable it by default,
247 * and spec now says 'Off by default'.
248 * We disabled this in ae23c24c32.
249 * Note that IranNastaliq uses this feature extensively
250 * to fixup broken glyph sequences. Oh well...
251 * Test case: U+0643,U+0640,U+0631. */
252 //map->enable_feature (HB_TAG('c','s','w','h'), F_MANUAL_ZWJ);
253 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG('m','s','e','t'), flags: F_MANUAL_ZWJ);
254}
255
256#include "hb-ot-shaper-arabic-fallback.hh"
257
258struct arabic_shape_plan_t
259{
260 /* The "+ 1" in the next array is to accommodate for the "NONE" command,
261 * which is not an OpenType feature, but this simplifies the code by not
262 * having to do a "if (... < NONE) ..." and just rely on the fact that
263 * mask_array[NONE] == 0. */
264 hb_mask_t mask_array[ARABIC_NUM_FEATURES + 1];
265
266 hb_atomic_ptr_t<arabic_fallback_plan_t> fallback_plan;
267
268 unsigned int do_fallback : 1;
269 unsigned int has_stch : 1;
270};
271
272void *
273data_create_arabic (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan)
274{
275 arabic_shape_plan_t *arabic_plan = (arabic_shape_plan_t *) hb_calloc (nmemb: 1, size: sizeof (arabic_shape_plan_t));
276 if (unlikely (!arabic_plan))
277 return nullptr;
278
279 arabic_plan->do_fallback = plan->props.script == HB_SCRIPT_ARABIC;
280 arabic_plan->has_stch = !!plan->map.get_1_mask (HB_TAG ('s','t','c','h'));
281 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < ARABIC_NUM_FEATURES; i++) {
282 arabic_plan->mask_array[i] = plan->map.get_1_mask (feature_tag: arabic_features[i]);
283 arabic_plan->do_fallback = arabic_plan->do_fallback &&
284 (FEATURE_IS_SYRIAC (arabic_features[i]) ||
285 plan->map.needs_fallback (feature_tag: arabic_features[i]));
286 }
287
288 return arabic_plan;
289}
290
291void
292data_destroy_arabic (void *data)
293{
294 arabic_shape_plan_t *arabic_plan = (arabic_shape_plan_t *) data;
295
296 arabic_fallback_plan_destroy (fallback_plan: arabic_plan->fallback_plan);
297
298 hb_free (ptr: data);
299}
300
301static void
302arabic_joining (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
303{
304 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
305 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
306 unsigned int prev = UINT_MAX, state = 0;
307
308 /* Check pre-context */
309 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < buffer->context_len[0]; i++)
310 {
311 unsigned int this_type = get_joining_type (u: buffer->context[0][i], gen_cat: buffer->unicode->general_category (unicode: buffer->context[0][i]));
312
313 if (unlikely (this_type == JOINING_TYPE_T))
314 continue;
315
316 const arabic_state_table_entry *entry = &arabic_state_table[state][this_type];
317 state = entry->next_state;
318 break;
319 }
320
321 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
322 {
323 unsigned int this_type = get_joining_type (u: info[i].codepoint, gen_cat: _hb_glyph_info_get_general_category (info: &info[i]));
324
325 if (unlikely (this_type == JOINING_TYPE_T)) {
326 info[i].arabic_shaping_action() = NONE;
327 continue;
328 }
329
330 const arabic_state_table_entry *entry = &arabic_state_table[state][this_type];
331
332 if (entry->prev_action != NONE && prev != UINT_MAX)
333 {
334 info[prev].arabic_shaping_action() = entry->prev_action;
335 buffer->safe_to_insert_tatweel (start: prev, end: i + 1);
336 }
337 else
338 {
339 if (prev == UINT_MAX)
340 {
341 if (this_type >= JOINING_TYPE_R)
342 buffer->unsafe_to_concat_from_outbuffer (start: 0, end: i + 1);
343 }
344 else
345 {
346 if (this_type >= JOINING_TYPE_R ||
347 (2 <= state && state <= 5) /* States that have a possible prev_action. */)
348 buffer->unsafe_to_concat (start: prev, end: i + 1);
349 }
350 }
351
352 info[i].arabic_shaping_action() = entry->curr_action;
353
354 prev = i;
355 state = entry->next_state;
356 }
357
358 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < buffer->context_len[1]; i++)
359 {
360 unsigned int this_type = get_joining_type (u: buffer->context[1][i], gen_cat: buffer->unicode->general_category (unicode: buffer->context[1][i]));
361
362 if (unlikely (this_type == JOINING_TYPE_T))
363 continue;
364
365 const arabic_state_table_entry *entry = &arabic_state_table[state][this_type];
366 if (entry->prev_action != NONE && prev != UINT_MAX)
367 {
368 info[prev].arabic_shaping_action() = entry->prev_action;
369 buffer->safe_to_insert_tatweel (start: prev, end: buffer->len);
370 }
371 else if (2 <= state && state <= 5) /* States that have a possible prev_action. */
372 {
373 buffer->unsafe_to_concat (start: prev, end: buffer->len);
374 }
375 break;
376 }
377}
378
379static void
380mongolian_variation_selectors (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
381{
382 /* Copy arabic_shaping_action() from base to Mongolian variation selectors. */
383 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
384 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
385 for (unsigned int i = 1; i < count; i++)
386 if (unlikely (hb_in_ranges<hb_codepoint_t> (info[i].codepoint, 0x180Bu, 0x180Du, 0x180Fu, 0x180Fu)))
387 info[i].arabic_shaping_action() = info[i - 1].arabic_shaping_action();
388}
389
390void
391setup_masks_arabic_plan (const arabic_shape_plan_t *arabic_plan,
392 hb_buffer_t *buffer,
393 hb_script_t script)
394{
395 HB_BUFFER_ALLOCATE_VAR (buffer, arabic_shaping_action);
396
397 arabic_joining (buffer);
398 if (script == HB_SCRIPT_MONGOLIAN)
399 mongolian_variation_selectors (buffer);
400
401 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
402 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
403 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
404 info[i].mask |= arabic_plan->mask_array[info[i].arabic_shaping_action()];
405}
406
407static void
408setup_masks_arabic (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan,
409 hb_buffer_t *buffer,
410 hb_font_t *font HB_UNUSED)
411{
412 const arabic_shape_plan_t *arabic_plan = (const arabic_shape_plan_t *) plan->data;
413 setup_masks_arabic_plan (arabic_plan, buffer, script: plan->props.script);
414}
415
416static bool
417arabic_fallback_shape (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan,
418 hb_font_t *font,
419 hb_buffer_t *buffer)
420{
421#ifdef HB_NO_OT_SHAPER_ARABIC_FALLBACK
422 return false;
423#endif
424
425 const arabic_shape_plan_t *arabic_plan = (const arabic_shape_plan_t *) plan->data;
426
427 if (!arabic_plan->do_fallback)
428 return false;
429
430retry:
431 arabic_fallback_plan_t *fallback_plan = arabic_plan->fallback_plan;
432 if (unlikely (!fallback_plan))
433 {
434 /* This sucks. We need a font to build the fallback plan... */
435 fallback_plan = arabic_fallback_plan_create (plan, font);
436 if (unlikely (!arabic_plan->fallback_plan.cmpexch (nullptr, fallback_plan)))
437 {
438 arabic_fallback_plan_destroy (fallback_plan);
439 goto retry;
440 }
441 }
442
443 arabic_fallback_plan_shape (fallback_plan, font, buffer);
444 return true;
445}
446
447/*
448 * Stretch feature: "stch".
449 * See example here:
450 * https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/script-development/syriac
451 * We implement this in a generic way, such that the Arabic subtending
452 * marks can use it as well.
453 */
454
455static bool
456record_stch (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan,
457 hb_font_t *font HB_UNUSED,
458 hb_buffer_t *buffer)
459{
460 const arabic_shape_plan_t *arabic_plan = (const arabic_shape_plan_t *) plan->data;
461 if (!arabic_plan->has_stch)
462 return false;
463
464 /* 'stch' feature was just applied. Look for anything that multiplied,
465 * and record it for stch treatment later. Note that rtlm, frac, etc
466 * are applied before stch, but we assume that they didn't result in
467 * anything multiplying into 5 pieces, so it's safe-ish... */
468
469 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
470 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
471 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
472 if (unlikely (_hb_glyph_info_multiplied (&info[i])))
473 {
474 unsigned int comp = _hb_glyph_info_get_lig_comp (info: &info[i]);
475 info[i].arabic_shaping_action() = comp % 2 ? STCH_REPEATING : STCH_FIXED;
476 buffer->scratch_flags |= HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_ARABIC_HAS_STCH;
477 }
478 return false;
479}
480
481static void
482apply_stch (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan HB_UNUSED,
483 hb_buffer_t *buffer,
484 hb_font_t *font)
485{
486 if (likely (!(buffer->scratch_flags & HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_ARABIC_HAS_STCH)))
487 return;
488
489 /* The Arabic shaper currently always processes in RTL mode, so we should
490 * stretch / position the stretched pieces to the left / preceding glyphs. */
491
492 /* We do a two pass implementation:
493 * First pass calculates the exact number of extra glyphs we need,
494 * We then enlarge buffer to have that much room,
495 * Second pass applies the stretch, copying things to the end of buffer.
496 */
497
498 int sign = font->x_scale < 0 ? -1 : +1;
499 unsigned int extra_glyphs_needed = 0; // Set during MEASURE, used during CUT
500 enum { MEASURE, CUT } /* step_t */;
501
502 for (unsigned int step = MEASURE; step <= CUT; step = step + 1)
503 {
504 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
505 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
506 hb_glyph_position_t *pos = buffer->pos;
507 unsigned int new_len = count + extra_glyphs_needed; // write head during CUT
508 unsigned int j = new_len;
509 for (unsigned int i = count; i; i--)
510 {
511 if (!hb_in_range<uint8_t> (u: info[i - 1].arabic_shaping_action(), lo: STCH_FIXED, hi: STCH_REPEATING))
512 {
513 if (step == CUT)
514 {
515 --j;
516 info[j] = info[i - 1];
517 pos[j] = pos[i - 1];
518 }
519 continue;
520 }
521
522 /* Yay, justification! */
523
524 hb_position_t w_total = 0; // Total to be filled
525 hb_position_t w_fixed = 0; // Sum of fixed tiles
526 hb_position_t w_repeating = 0; // Sum of repeating tiles
527 int n_fixed = 0;
528 int n_repeating = 0;
529
530 unsigned int end = i;
531 while (i &&
532 hb_in_range<uint8_t> (u: info[i - 1].arabic_shaping_action(), lo: STCH_FIXED, hi: STCH_REPEATING))
533 {
534 i--;
535 hb_position_t width = font->get_glyph_h_advance (glyph: info[i].codepoint);
536 if (info[i].arabic_shaping_action() == STCH_FIXED)
537 {
538 w_fixed += width;
539 n_fixed++;
540 }
541 else
542 {
543 w_repeating += width;
544 n_repeating++;
545 }
546 }
547 unsigned int start = i;
548 unsigned int context = i;
549 while (context &&
550 !hb_in_range<uint8_t> (u: info[context - 1].arabic_shaping_action(), lo: STCH_FIXED, hi: STCH_REPEATING) &&
551 (_hb_glyph_info_is_default_ignorable (info: &info[context - 1]) ||
552 HB_ARABIC_GENERAL_CATEGORY_IS_WORD (_hb_glyph_info_get_general_category (&info[context - 1]))))
553 {
554 context--;
555 w_total += pos[context].x_advance;
556 }
557 i++; // Don't touch i again.
558
559 DEBUG_MSG (ARABIC, nullptr, "%s stretch at (%u,%u,%u)",
560 step == MEASURE ? "measuring" : "cutting", context, start, end);
561 DEBUG_MSG (ARABIC, nullptr, "rest of word: count=%u width %d", start - context, w_total);
562 DEBUG_MSG (ARABIC, nullptr, "fixed tiles: count=%d width=%d", n_fixed, w_fixed);
563 DEBUG_MSG (ARABIC, nullptr, "repeating tiles: count=%d width=%d", n_repeating, w_repeating);
564
565 /* Number of additional times to repeat each repeating tile. */
566 int n_copies = 0;
567
568 hb_position_t w_remaining = w_total - w_fixed;
569 if (sign * w_remaining > sign * w_repeating && sign * w_repeating > 0)
570 n_copies = (sign * w_remaining) / (sign * w_repeating) - 1;
571
572 /* See if we can improve the fit by adding an extra repeat and squeezing them together a bit. */
573 hb_position_t extra_repeat_overlap = 0;
574 hb_position_t shortfall = sign * w_remaining - sign * w_repeating * (n_copies + 1);
575 if (shortfall > 0 && n_repeating > 0)
576 {
577 ++n_copies;
578 hb_position_t excess = (n_copies + 1) * sign * w_repeating - sign * w_remaining;
579 if (excess > 0)
580 extra_repeat_overlap = excess / (n_copies * n_repeating);
581 }
582
583 if (step == MEASURE)
584 {
585 extra_glyphs_needed += n_copies * n_repeating;
586 DEBUG_MSG (ARABIC, nullptr, "will add extra %d copies of repeating tiles", n_copies);
587 }
588 else
589 {
590 buffer->unsafe_to_break (start: context, end);
591 hb_position_t x_offset = 0;
592 for (unsigned int k = end; k > start; k--)
593 {
594 hb_position_t width = font->get_glyph_h_advance (glyph: info[k - 1].codepoint);
595
596 unsigned int repeat = 1;
597 if (info[k - 1].arabic_shaping_action() == STCH_REPEATING)
598 repeat += n_copies;
599
600 DEBUG_MSG (ARABIC, nullptr, "appending %u copies of glyph %u; j=%u",
601 repeat, info[k - 1].codepoint, j);
602 for (unsigned int n = 0; n < repeat; n++)
603 {
604 x_offset -= width;
605 if (n > 0)
606 x_offset += extra_repeat_overlap;
607 pos[k - 1].x_offset = x_offset;
608 /* Append copy. */
609 --j;
610 info[j] = info[k - 1];
611 pos[j] = pos[k - 1];
612 }
613 }
614 }
615 }
616
617 if (step == MEASURE)
618 {
619 if (unlikely (!buffer->ensure (count + extra_glyphs_needed)))
620 break;
621 }
622 else
623 {
624 assert (j == 0);
625 buffer->len = new_len;
626 }
627 }
628}
629
630
631static void
632postprocess_glyphs_arabic (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan,
633 hb_buffer_t *buffer,
634 hb_font_t *font)
635{
636 apply_stch (plan, buffer, font);
637}
638
639/* https://www.unicode.org/reports/tr53/ */
640
641static hb_codepoint_t
642modifier_combining_marks[] =
643{
644 0x0654u, /* ARABIC HAMZA ABOVE */
645 0x0655u, /* ARABIC HAMZA BELOW */
646 0x0658u, /* ARABIC MARK NOON GHUNNA */
647 0x06DCu, /* ARABIC SMALL HIGH SEEN */
648 0x06E3u, /* ARABIC SMALL LOW SEEN */
649 0x06E7u, /* ARABIC SMALL HIGH YEH */
650 0x06E8u, /* ARABIC SMALL HIGH NOON */
651 0x08CAu, /* ARABIC SMALL HIGH FARSI YEH */
652 0x08CBu, /* ARABIC SMALL HIGH YEH BARREE WITH TWO DOTS BELOW */
653 0x08CDu, /* ARABIC SMALL HIGH ZAH */
654 0x08CEu, /* ARABIC LARGE ROUND DOT ABOVE */
655 0x08CFu, /* ARABIC LARGE ROUND DOT BELOW */
656 0x08D3u, /* ARABIC SMALL LOW WAW */
657 0x08F3u, /* ARABIC SMALL HIGH WAW */
658};
659
660static inline bool
661info_is_mcm (const hb_glyph_info_t &info)
662{
663 hb_codepoint_t u = info.codepoint;
664 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < ARRAY_LENGTH (modifier_combining_marks); i++)
665 if (u == modifier_combining_marks[i])
666 return true;
667 return false;
668}
669
670static void
671reorder_marks_arabic (const hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan HB_UNUSED,
672 hb_buffer_t *buffer,
673 unsigned int start,
674 unsigned int end)
675{
676 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
677
678 DEBUG_MSG (ARABIC, buffer, "Reordering marks from %u to %u", start, end);
679
680 unsigned int i = start;
681 for (unsigned int cc = 220; cc <= 230; cc += 10)
682 {
683 DEBUG_MSG (ARABIC, buffer, "Looking for %u's starting at %u", cc, i);
684 while (i < end && info_cc(info[i]) < cc)
685 i++;
686 DEBUG_MSG (ARABIC, buffer, "Looking for %u's stopped at %u", cc, i);
687
688 if (i == end)
689 break;
690
691 if (info_cc(info[i]) > cc)
692 continue;
693
694 unsigned int j = i;
695 while (j < end && info_cc(info[j]) == cc && info_is_mcm (info: info[j]))
696 j++;
697
698 if (i == j)
699 continue;
700
701 DEBUG_MSG (ARABIC, buffer, "Found %u's from %u to %u", cc, i, j);
702
703 /* Shift it! */
704 DEBUG_MSG (ARABIC, buffer, "Shifting %u's: %u %u", cc, i, j);
705 hb_glyph_info_t temp[HB_OT_SHAPE_MAX_COMBINING_MARKS];
706 assert (j - i <= ARRAY_LENGTH (temp));
707 buffer->merge_clusters (start, end: j);
708 memmove (dest: temp, src: &info[i], n: (j - i) * sizeof (hb_glyph_info_t));
709 memmove (dest: &info[start + j - i], src: &info[start], n: (i - start) * sizeof (hb_glyph_info_t));
710 memmove (dest: &info[start], src: temp, n: (j - i) * sizeof (hb_glyph_info_t));
711
712 /* Renumber CC such that the reordered sequence is still sorted.
713 * 22 and 26 are chosen because they are smaller than all Arabic categories,
714 * and are folded back to 220/230 respectively during fallback mark positioning.
715 *
716 * We do this because the CGJ-handling logic in the normalizer relies on
717 * mark sequences having an increasing order even after this reordering.
718 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/554
719 * This, however, does break some obscure sequences, where the normalizer
720 * might compose a sequence that it should not. For example, in the seequence
721 * ALEF, HAMZAH, MADDAH, we should NOT try to compose ALEF+MADDAH, but with this
722 * renumbering, we will.
723 */
724 unsigned int new_start = start + j - i;
725 unsigned int new_cc = cc == 220 ? HB_MODIFIED_COMBINING_CLASS_CCC22 : HB_MODIFIED_COMBINING_CLASS_CCC26;
726 while (start < new_start)
727 {
728 _hb_glyph_info_set_modified_combining_class (info: &info[start], modified_class: new_cc);
729 start++;
730 }
731
732 i = j;
733 }
734}
735
736const hb_ot_shaper_t _hb_ot_shaper_arabic =
737{
738 .collect_features: collect_features_arabic,
739 .override_features: nullptr, /* override_features */
740 .data_create: data_create_arabic,
741 .data_destroy: data_destroy_arabic,
742 .preprocess_text: nullptr, /* preprocess_text */
743 .postprocess_glyphs: postprocess_glyphs_arabic,
744 .decompose: nullptr, /* decompose */
745 .compose: nullptr, /* compose */
746 .setup_masks: setup_masks_arabic,
747 .reorder_marks: reorder_marks_arabic,
748 HB_TAG_NONE, /* gpos_tag */
749 .normalization_preference: HB_OT_SHAPE_NORMALIZATION_MODE_DEFAULT,
750 .zero_width_marks: HB_OT_SHAPE_ZERO_WIDTH_MARKS_BY_GDEF_LATE,
751 .fallback_position: true, /* fallback_position */
752};
